respStmt.resp: Conversion to TEI based on earlier work for the ENRICH project (enrich@oucs.ox.ac.uk; http://tei.oucs.ox.ac.uk/ENRICH/)

supportDesc.extent: fragment of a leaf, and of a bifolium
one leaf, mutilated in the middle

msItem.title: Distinctiones
msItem.note: From caritas to cathedra, numbered XX–XXVI.

msItem.title: Commentary on Peter Lombard, Sentences
msItem.note: II. dist.5 art.I–II, incorporating part of St.Bonaventure's commentary as pr. in Opera, ed. Quaracchi, II pp.145–51. The correct order of the leaves is: fol.14bR, 14bV, 14aV, 14aR.

msItem.author: Petrus Comestor
msItem.title: Historia Scholastica
msItem.note: Esther 9 - I Maccabees 8, P.L. 198 col.1503–1513 with glosses added in a later hand, lines numbered by 5's.

msItem.author: Peter Lombard
msItem.title: Sentences
msItem.note: II dist. 34.4 – 35.2, (fol.26) II dist. 35.4 – 38.2, (fol.30) II.dist.38.4 – 39.3, (fol.31) II.dist.42.5 – 43.1, (fol.32) III.dist.3.4 – 4.2, with some marginal glosses.

msItem.title: Commentary on Augustine, De Doctrina Christiana
Sermons
msItem.note: Collection of Sunday sermons. Chaldee numbering at the top of the leaves.

msItem.title: Commentary on Apocalypse
msItem.note: Part of a commentary on Apocalypse, followed by a letter relating to criticisms of the same. Among works cited is (fol.47) the Paris edition of Justin Martyr, 1615.

msItem.author: J. H. Bernard, Protestant archbishop of Dublin
msItem.title: Index to the quotations from the Old Testament in the writings of St.Hilary
Letter on the eucharist
msItem.explicit: per desiderium eterne vite transeamus ad eternam et perpetuam vitam

msItem.title: Sermons
msItem.incipit: Rationem reddituri sumus ego et vos (first sermon)

msItem.author: Gregory
msItem.title: Moralia in Iob
msItem.note: bk.I ch.VII–IX, P.L.75 col.531–3, (fol.80) bk.I.ch.XXV–XXVII, col.543–4, (fol.81) bk.I ch.XXXVI, col.550–2, (fol.82) bk.II ch.VII–VIII, col.561–2, (fol.84) bk.VIII ch.XXXVII, col.764–5, (fol.85) bk.VII ch.XXVI, col.783–4. Fol.83 cannot be identified.

supportDesc.extent: Two bifolia and three single leaves

msItem.title: Theological text
msItem.note: On the seven gifts of the Holy Ghost and the seven pains of Hell.

msItem.title: Lists of contents to Vincent of Beauvais, Speculum Historiale, bks. 25 and 26

supportDesc.extent: one leaf and part of a bifolium

msItem.author: Petrus de Capua
msItem.title: Distinctiones
msItem.note: manifestatio, margarita, mola, mare. The leaf should be reversed.
Five fragments, taken from printed books in the Lyell collection, including:
Another leaf from the same MS.

msItem.title: Devotion
msItem.note: Part of a devotion containing a prayer.

history.provenance: Used as flyleaf for a book.
Found with miscellaneous deeds of G. J. Dew, 1968.

msItem.title: Commentary on Pauline epistles
msItem.note: Parts of commentary on Ephesians and Philippians.
Leaves from the binding of Allen e. 190; no detailed description available.

history.provenance: Transferred from Oxfordshire Record Office, c. 1964.
